content.description:
Sit start at top of dirt chute leading over the falls, with a left hand on the dark colored slopey ball, and right hand pinching the edged Arete.

Work your way up the Arete and face, with a gigantic sloper top out featuring a few micro pockets.

A high heel hook over the waterfall to a perfect half pad crimp rail, then a high, classic Castle Rock sloper top-out.

The start holds are solid, so is the middle and top, but right after the start is an easy section that is still a bit gravely. Will firm up with traffic I’m guessing.

Borderline highball with normal falls mostly safe, but a super awkward fall on the start or the top out could result in a 60 foot drop off the waterfall cliff. Be safe!

* Alex M shared this as a FA? in August 2020, proposed V8. A lot of the waves back here had been climbed but no other info out there on this one that came out. It's a pretty good one to go forgotten imo, but never know at CR - any more info DM me or change the details!
content.location:
The line is in the muffins area of CR, and starts right next to the anchors at the top of Clamydia (5.11d).

There’s a few rows/waves in the lower muffins area, and this problem is on the third wave (uphill from the wave with Sticky Green Traverse and Pocket Face).

content.description: Aka “Small Pockets”. Stand start in finger pockets and top out over the edge with some great views over Castle Rock Falls
content.location: This is in the Lower Muffins. See sub area directions. This is on the second wave of rock up, so if approaching from the creek below, scramble up and to the right of the first wave and this problem (which is also the start of Sticky Green Traverse) is right on the left as you come over the first wave.
